result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daron R Hazley appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Daron R Hazley.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Received and Filed. Revised DPA Update 10-25-22- Hazley, Daron R.pdf
Received and Filed. Essay
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. DPA Update 10-25-22- Hazley, Daron R.pdf
Received and Filed. DPA Update 9-27-22

Defendant Daron R Hazley not in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Daron R Hazley.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for review hearing.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned for Calendar Call and Review Hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Daron R Hazley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.
 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received and filed
WIS JI - Criminal

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Defendant Daron R Hazley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and has submitted a counter offer for the State to Consider.
State confirms receipt of defense email for a DPA pending tad evaluation.  Defense reqeust a DPA hearing/ status date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Joseph domask, signed and filed.
Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Joseph Domask to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel amd Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Daron R Hazley in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.   Case in court for an Initial Appearance. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court proceeds with an indigency hearing.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daron R Hazley
Current: 6947 Everhart Road  Apartment 406, Corpus Christi, TX 78413 United States  (Effective: 05-05-2022)
Prior: 8012 West Appleton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Daron R Hazley not in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 2p
